title: Prince Harry gives glimpse inside Eugenie's palace home - including huge romantic photo
text:
Get the biggest Royal Family stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Prince Harry and Ed Sheeran's World Mental Health Day spoof video has been a big hit with fans, raising awareness of the important issue which they are both extremely passionate about.

The funny clip shows the two stars sitting in a cosy dining room chatting about the importance of discussing 'a subject and conversation that is just not talked about' - before an awkward mix up from Ed, who believes they are about to launch a 'Gingers Unite'.

The video is a key example of Harry approaching his charity work in a more modern and personal way than we're used to seeing from members in the Royal Family, and it has delighted fans.

It also gives us a rare insight into the Royals' lives away from the cameras as it appears to be filmed at Princess Eugenie and Jack Brooksbank's Kensington Palace home.

It starts with Ed ringing the (very royal sounding) doorbell on white door, before Harry opens the door.

As he does, we get a look inside the hallway and can see a very, very romantic large canvas print on the wall behind him.

The picture is a black and white snap from Eugenie and Jack's Royal Wedding back in October , showing them sharing a kiss in the back of the carriage as they rode around Windsor waving to well-wishers.

The walls are painted white and there is a large traditional fireplace below the cute photo.

(Image: SussexRoyal/Instagram)

(Image: PA)

The full video, which Harry and wife Meghan Markle shared on their Instagram page SussexRoyal this morning, shows more of the cosy cottage.

The couple have wooden floors and the dining area is painted in a lovely pastel green colour.

The wooden dining table has a number of mix match white and white cushions and there are more pictures on the walls in minimal white frames.

Eugenie and Jack are two of a number of royals who live at Kensington Palace, moving into Ivy Cottage a few years back.

Their house is just behind the cottage Meghan and Harry shared before they moved to Windsor shortly after their wedding to set up a family home.

The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and their kids Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis live in the biggest property at the palace - Apartment 1A.

The huge house, which used to be Princess Margaret's home, has more than 20 rooms including five reception rooms, two nurseries, dressing rooms and staff quarters.

(Image: Getty Images)

The family have been living in the gorgeous property since they moved back to London from Norfolk but things are set to change very soon as they are about to get some new neighbours .

The next door Apartment 1 - the palace's second largest property - is now empty after Queen's cousin Prince Richard and his Danish-born wife Birgitte moved out last week.

Moving vans were spotted at KP helping to move the couple out of the huge property and around the corner to the Old Stables, which is still within the grounds of Kensington Palace.

(Image: ,)

Meghan Markle and Prince Harry were due to move into Apartment 1 after their Royal Wedding last year, but changed their minds and decided to move to Frogmore Cottage in Windsor instead.

Renovation work had already started before the idea was scrapped, with scaffolding and white tarpaulin put around the roof.

But since the Sussexes decided to turn it down, who will be moving into the royal home?

Many people believe that Princess Eugenie and her new husband Jack Brooksbank could set up home there, especially if they are hoping to start a family.
description: Prince Harry teamed up with Ed Sheeran to film a short spoof video to mark World Mental Health Day, and the relaxed video was filmed at Kensington Palace
